title: rustc error while toying with Iterator and yield

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust fn iter_call() -> impl Iterator { yield foo } fn main() { } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0 (02072b482 2022-01-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 02072b482a8b5357f7fb5e5637444ae30e423c40 commit-date: 2022-01-11 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` [foo1]$ cargo build Compiling foo1 v0.1.0 (/foo1) error[E0425]: cannot find value `foo` in this scope --> src/main.rs:2:11 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^ not found in this scope error[E0658]: yield syntax is experimental --> src/main.rs:2:5 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #43122 for more information error[E0627]: yield expression outside of generator literal --> src/main.rs:2:5 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^^^^^^^ error[E0277]: `()` is not an iterator --> src/main.rs:1:19 | 1 | fn iter_call() -> impl Iterator { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `()` is not an iterator | = help: the trait `Iterator` is not implemented for `()` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: body.yield_ty().is_some() == universal_regions.yield_ty.is_some()', compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/type_check/input_output.rs:120:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0 (02072b482 2022-01-11) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `iter_call` #1 [type_of] computing type of `iter_call::{opaque#0}` end of query stack Some errors have detailed explanations: E0277, E0425, E0627, E0658. For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0277`. error: could not compile `foo1` due to 4 previous errors ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling foo1 v0.1.0 /foo1) error[E0425]: cannot find value `foo` in this scope --> src/main.rs:2:11 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^ not found in this scope error[E0658]: yield syntax is experimental --> src/main.rs:2:5 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #43122 for more information error[E0627]: yield expression outside of generator literal --> src/main.rs:2:5 | 2 | yield foo | ^^^^^^^^^ error[E0277]: `()` is not an iterator --> src/main.rs:1:19 | 1 | fn iter_call() -> impl Iterator { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `()` is not an iterator | = help: the trait `Iterator` is not implemented for `()` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: body.yield_ty().is_some() == universal_regions.yield_ty.is_some()', compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/type_check/input_output.rs:120:9 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/02072b482a8b5357f7fb5e5637444ae30e423c40/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/02072b482a8b5357f7fb5e5637444ae30e423c40/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/02072b482a8b5357f7fb5e5637444ae30e423c40/library/core/src/panicking.rs:48:5 3: rustc_borrowck::type_check::type_check 4: rustc_borrowck::nll::compute_regions 5: rustc_borrowck::do_mir_borrowck 6: ::enter:: 7: rustc_borrowck::mir_borrowck 8: >::call_once 9: >::with_task:: 10: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::query::BorrowCheckResult, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 11: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 12: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 13: rustc_typeck::collect::type_of::type_of 14: >::with_task:: 15: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::ty::TyS, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 16: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 17: ::type_of 18: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_item_type 19: ::visit_item_likes_in_module:: 20: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_mod_item_types 21: >::with_task:: 22: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<((), rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 23: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 25: ::for_each_module:: 26: rustc_typeck::check_crate 27: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 28: >::with_task::> 29: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 30: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 31: ::analysis 32: ::enter::> 33: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 34: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 35: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0 (02072b482 2022-01-11) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `iter_call` #1 [type_of] computing type of `iter_call::{opaque#0}` #2 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in top-level module #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack Some errors have detailed explanations: E0277, E0425, E0627, E0658. For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0277`. error: could not compile `foo1` due to 4 previous errors ```
